taskbody.context: Before a user can launch a new instance, they must create a public/private key pair to use to authenticate to the instance during log in. The public key will automatically be added to the newly created instance. The private key must be used with Secure Shell (SSH) to connect to the instance. Euca2ools provide the user a mechanism to create a key pair and to download their private key to a locally stored file.

step.cmd: On the Desktop, open an SSH session to the front-end host if an SSH session is not currently open.
On the front-end host use the euca-describe-keypairs command to list any existing key pairs.

info.p: Were there any key pairs listed? There should not have been.

step.cmd: On the front-end host, create a new key pair named adminkey. Ensure that the private key is redirected into a file in the /root directory.

info.codeblock: # cd /root # euca-create-keypair adminkey | tee adminkey.pem # ls -l

step.cmd: On the front-end host use the euca-describe-keypairs command again to list any existing key pairs.

info.p: Were there any key pairs listed? There should have been.

step.cmd: On the Debian desktop open an xterm window. In the window use the Secure Copy program to copy the private key file in /root on the front-end host to the /root directory on the Debian desktop. Use the public IP address of the front-end host. The public IP is listed in your student handout. When prompted for the password, the password should be passwordNN, where NN is the number of your student pod.

info.note: This step was necessary to prepare for a future lab exercise.

step.cmd: Close the open xterm window on the Debian desktop.
